comments:
When I move from M6 to M7 I am getting the following exception when I open a
properties or preferences page (from the CDT).   It looks like there was a
change to this class that breaks the assumptions about what type of Control is
expected.

Created an attachment (id=20835)
patch to check for different types of Control data parameters

I set the target milestone to M7 so that I could get a response ASAP
This failure would block the migration of the CDT to M7.

It is a programming error to assign a GridData to a widget that is not in a 
GridLayout.  The team that has provided this prefernce page should fix their 
code.  Is this possible for M7?
Fixed from the CDT side - can close. Thanks!

Thanks for the quick response (both from CDT and the platform).   
I will mark this a fixed.
Hi Veronica, was the patch checked in to Eclipse 3.1.0?   I have the Eclipse 3.1.0 source for SWT but I don't see the patch applied to FillLayout.java.
Hi Veronika, was the patch checked in to Eclipse 3.1.0?   I have the Eclipse 3.1.0 source for SWT but I don't see the patch applied to FillLayout.java.
As mentioned in comment #3, this is a programming error in the application code and the patch was not applied to SWT.
